current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the Older Americans Act of 1965 to provide for a Seniors' Financial Bill of Rights, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

short-title.#text: Seniors' Financial Bill of Rights Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 201(e)(2) of the Older Americans Act
			 of 1965

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , by striking the period at the end and inserting

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Office of Older Americans of the Consumer
				Financial Protection Bureau
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Office of Older Americans of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
President's Advisory Council on Financial
				Capability of the Department of the Treasury
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: President's Advisory Council on Financial Capability

text.#text:
to coordinate, with
				other Federal agencies including the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, preventing
				and responding to the financial exploitation of older individuals, establishing
				a geographically based measure of economic security, and providing the services
				and supports needed for the economic security of older
				individuals.

text.#text:
to use the coordinated activities and
				research to make available to States and local organizations resources,
				technical assistance, and information for the purpose of carrying out the State
				Seniors' Financial Bills of Rights described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 307(a) of the Older Americans Act of
			 1965

text.#text:
The plan shall
				include an assurance that the State will establish—

a State Seniors'
				Financial Bill of Rights that—

addresses access
				by older individuals to—

sufficient
				information about their financial rights, specifically rights with regard to
				powers of attorney and the duties of their agents or attorneys under a power of
				attorney, and of fiduciaries;

financial
				counseling resources to make informed financial choices;

legal
				assistance to protect their financial rights;

adult protective
				services and appropriate law enforcement and regulatory authorities, in
				situations in which financial exploitation is alleged or suspected; and
information about signs of financial exploitation and where to go for help; and

assures that
				agents or attorneys under a power of attorney, fiduciaries, staff that provide
				long-term care, financial institutions, and law enforcement agencies have
				sufficient information about the financial rights of, and signs of financial
				exploitation of, older individuals; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to
				obtain those rights to information, resources, and assistance, as the case may
				be.

text.#text:
means for older
				individuals, and individuals and entities described in

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1734 IS: Seniors' Financial Bill of Rights Act

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
